body_html:
As @quaeler stated, we build and test TensorFlow on MacOS using default clang that comes with Xcode. Our build system has some hardcoded compile and link options based on OS, and the MacOS options in the system may not match what GCC on MacOS provides.

@facaiy Would it be possible for you to try using clang (that is distributed with Xcode) on your machine instead of GCC?
body_text:
As @quaeler stated, we build and test TensorFlow on MacOS using default clang that comes with Xcode. Our build system has some hardcoded compile and link options based on OS, and the MacOS options in the system may not match what GCC on MacOS provides.
@facaiy Would it be possible for you to try using clang (that is distributed with Xcode) on your machine instead of GCC?
body:
As @quaeler stated, we build and test TensorFlow on MacOS using default clang that comes with Xcode. Our build system has some hardcoded compile and link options based on OS, and the MacOS options in the system may not match what GCC on MacOS provides.

@facaiy Would it be possible for you to try using clang (that is distributed with Xcode) on your machine instead of GCC?
